noun.description: Thick, durable twilled cloth with a short nap, usually dyed in dark colors.
Pompous or pretentious speech or writing.
examples: a smoke screen of fustian and fantasy

origin: Middle English: from Old French fustaigne, from medieval Latin fustaneum, from ( pannus) fustaneus cloth from Fostat, a suburb of Cairo; fustian (sense 2) perhaps from the fact that fustian was sometimes used to cover pillows and cushions, implying that the language was padded; compare with bombast.
